titleStmt.title: Jacksonville Negro Welfare League Letter. November 12, 1930.
titleStmt.author: A. L. Lewis

publicationStmt.p: This document forms part of the project "Editing the Earth M.M. White Collection" at the University of North Florida.

msIdentifier.repository: University of North Florida, Thomas G. Carpenter Library Special Collections and Archives

msContents.summary: Author writes to the Jacksonville Negro Welfare League Board of Directors on donating to the Community Chest Drive.

objectDesc.p: A single page typewritten letter from Lewis, president of the Jacksonville Negro Welfare League, to its board. The letter has the organization's heading.

editorialDecl.p: This file was transcribed and encoded according to the editorial criteria of the project "Editing the Eartha M.M. White Collection." Using the various options encoded within <choice> elements, this file enables the viewing of a diplomatic transcription and a regularized reading text.

div.head:
Department
Community Chest Association of Duval County
Jacksonville, Fla.

opener.salute:
To each member of the Board of Directors,
Jacksonville Negro Welfare League>
Jacksonville, Florida.
Dear Co-worker:

div.p:
As you know, we begin our Community Chest Drive on the
14th of November in order to raise our quota to assist
in taking care of the colored units of the Jacksonville
Negro Welfare League. I am pleased to report that we
have had several meetings which have very enthusi-
astic. All the members of the Board were delighted to
do their bit to relieve the suffering in our City by
subscribing to this laudable cause.
Being a member of the Board, holding this honored posi-
tion, we thought we would ask that each member of the
Board subscribe first, and we are also asking you subscribe not less than $10.00 if possible. You will
have six months in which to pay it. We have twenty
members on the Board, so we ought to get at least $200
or more from our bunch. You have always been loyal, and
contributed each year a liberal amount. May we depend
on you? I am contributing $50.00 to the Chest. You
may not see your way clear to contribute that much, but
I trust you will be one among the big givers this year.

We are planning to have an Executive Secretary to take charge
of the office and after the interest of our Group in Jackson-
ville. Many things are happening each day against us. Someone
must assist in doing the work. We are enclosing a subscription
blank. You may place the amount you subscribe on same and
return to this office, together with your first payment on
pledge. Please pay as much as possible with pledge.
Thank you in advance for whatever you may give, I am,

closer.signed:
Jacksonville Negro Welfare League
By A.L. Lewis
President

div.p:
Joe H. James Jr.
Campaign Mgr.Campaign Manager
D.H. Dwight,
Asst. Campaign Mgr.Assistant Campaign Manager
Phone 5-4677
